articles.description: Jude Bellingham scores late as Real Madrid beat Barcelona to move 11 points clear at the top of La Liga after an enthralling El Clasico.
articles.title: Bellingham strikes late as Real win El Clasico

articles.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag admits his side "got away with it" to reach the FA Cup final after their shootout victory against Coventry.
articles.title: 'We got away with it' - 'embarrassment' could 'cost Ten Hag job'

articles.description: Coventry's epic FA Cup semi-final with Manchester United, when the Sky Blues came from 3-0 down to force penalties, will be talked about "forever".
articles.title: ‘They will talk about this forever’ – Coventry close to ‘greatest story'

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?
articles.title: Who is the striker of the moment? Garth Crooks' Team of the Week

articles.description: MOTD2 pundit and former Liverpool midfielder Danny Murphy says the Reds' refreshed midfield was the key to Sunday's win over Fulham.
articles.title: How clever Klopp’s changes kept Liverpool in title fight

articles.description: Lando Norris confirms his elevation into Formula 1's elite with an exceptional drive to second place in the Chinese Grand Prix.
articles.title: Chinese Grand Prix 2024: 'Lando Norris' performance confirms elevation to elite-level'

articles.description: England's 14-try victory over Ireland at Twickenham sets up another Women's Six Nations Grand Slam decider against France.
articles.title: Can France stop England's Grand Slam bid?

articles.description: Nottingham Forest say they are "considering their options" over "extremely poor" refereeing decisions in their 2-0 loss at Everton.
articles.title: Forest question VAR official and 'consider options'

articles.description: Jayson Tatum's triple-double helps top seeds the Boston Celtics to victory in their NBA play-off series-opener against the Miami Heat.
articles.title: 2024 NBA play-offs: Top seeds Boston Celtics beat Miami Heat in opener

articles.description: Everton manager Sean Dyche ditched his trademark white shirt and dark tie as an indication the party was over for his humiliated players and everyone else at this under-siege football club.
articles.title: 'Some light at end of very dark tunnel for Everton'
